On Escalation Ticket # 00415592 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00415592 the new comment has been added: Robert Zavalczki:

@WaitingOnEngineer indeed the customer's claim is true. Testing with this website: https://browserleaks.com/tls we can tell that due to DPI, connection to deprecated TLS1.0 and TLS1.1 websites is possible.

We can disable support for deprecated TLS versions from our DPI feature. However, we have to be aware that this will prevent access to websites that use these old TLS versions.

I propose that we remove support for TLS1.0 and TLS1.1 which are deprecated. I will also check which weak cipher suites we should disable.

[DevOps CommentId:10705384]

On Escalation Ticket # 00415592 the new comment has been added: Robert Zavalczki:

@WaitingOnEngineer

I did some tests and made sure that Endpoint Protector DPI doesn't enable any more weak cipher suites than a typcal web browser.

Anyway, we will disable all weak cipher suites when we will upgrade the OpenSSL library to version 3.x as part of this task: ESCALATION 342967

As for disabling the weak TLS protocols, I can provide a test-build on request.

[DevOps CommentId:10709609]

Thank you for the update, Robert.
Please provide the test build when it will be available

Thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00415592 the new comment has been added: Krzysztof Staszalek:

@WaitingOnEngineer 
Please find external download links:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp09092024/EPPClient_v6.2.3.0057.zip 
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp09092024/EPPMac3.0.3.0024.Notarized.tar

Please remember that those are test builds, not QA tested, which should be only used to confirm bug fix, and shouldn't be deployed on mass scale on production. 

As part of request I confirm this test builds cover all 3 Booking requests, based on RN:


--- CODE ---
Notes

- test build for support using the 5.9.4.0 product update as base
- made from the "testbuild/#347188-disable-weak-tls" branch, commit 865d5d4c551
- cherry picked commit: "update libevent x64" from branch:
  "support/ADO-348124_libevent_issues" for #348124 "EPP writes every ~10 seconds
  a 0 byte .tpm file in temp directory"
What's New
- Disable weak/deprecated TLS protocols TLS 1.0 and 1.1 in DPI. Enabling DPI
  would allow weak TLS protocols, even if the browser of OS disallows them.
  #347188
--- CODE ---

[DevOps CommentId:10893431]

On Escalation Ticket # 00415592 the new comment has been added: Robert Zavalczki:

@WaitingOnEngineer Test builds for Windows and macOS are available on the file-server at the following locations:


--- CODE ---
Public/groups/_daily_builds/CoSoSys/2024-builds/2024_09_02/EPPClient_v6.2.3.0057
Public/groups/_daily_builds/CoSoSys/2024-builds/2024_09_02/EppMac_v3.0.3.0024
--- CODE ---

Both builds are based on the 5.9.4 release and the build for Windows contains the fix for #348124 and the macOS build contains the fix for #347176, fixes requested by the same customer.

[DevOps CommentId:10927280]

Hello,

The customer tested the new agent and he confirmed that the deprecated TLS versions are now disabled.

This is their feedback:
"I attached the supported TLS cipher suites in the client side in Chrome and Firefox when DPI is enabled and disabled.
I can confirm that now deprecated TLS versions are disabled when DPI is enabled. Good, thanks.
Though, still, when DPI is enabled, the client supports many more weak cipher suites compared to the default behaviour as can be seen in the attached results. There is still room for improvement on that side for you to evaluate and consider."

Let me know if there is something we can do about the weak cipher suites.

Thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00415592 the new comment has been added: Robert Zavalczki:

@WaitingOnEngineer we did not touch the enabled cipher suites because we were about to upgrade the OpenSSL library from version 1.1.1w to version 3.0 LTS and that would already remove some deprecated ciphers. We could revisit this with the upgraded OpenSSL library and see if there are any cipher suites that we should remove.

The OpenSSL upgrade is included in the 5.9.4.1 product release. FYI @WaitingOnEngineer

[DevOps CommentId:11208974]

On Escalation Ticket # 00415592 the new comment has been added: Hello,

Do we have a test agent where the OpenSSL library is updated to 3.0 LTS?
It would be good if we could send a test build to the customer so they can see that some of the deprecated ciphers are removed.

Also, would it be possible to remove all the deprecated ciphers for the client build which will be released in the 5.9.4.1 or 5.9.5.0 server version?

Thank you,
